snippet: A former ferry, which began leaking and listing off Newburgh over the weekend, had been eyed by the chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten as a possible lobster shack.
abstract: Chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten reveals that he had been negotiating to buy decommissioned Staten Island ferry from owner David Mitchell and turn the vessel into a waterside restaurant; ferry, however, began taking on water and is now partly resting on the bottom of the Hudson River in Newburgh, NY; it is unclear if the boat can be salvaged and the project revived.
lead_paragraph: A former ferry, which began leaking and listing off Newburgh over the weekend, had been eyed by the chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten as a possible lobster shack.

headline.seo: Before It Swamped, Chef Had Eyed Ferry as Restaurant
headline.main: Before Ferry Swamped, Chef Had Idea for It
headline.print_headline: Before Ferry Swamped, Chef Had Idea for It
